thread.title: Freedom Caucus Claims It Has Enough Votes To Kill Health Care Law
thread.title_full: Freedom Caucus Claims It Has Enough Votes To Kill Health Care Law

author: Randy DeSoto
title: Freedom Caucus Claims It Has Enough Votes To Kill Health Care Law
text:
Freedom Caucus Claims It Has Enough Votes To Kill Health Care Law "Member by member, we keep seeing ..." by Randy DeSoto March 22, 2017 at 3:49pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
The House Freedom Caucus said Wednesday it has the votes needed to bring down the Republican health care plan to replace ObamaCare. 
Rep. Mark Meadows, R-N.C., chairman of the caucus, said he has 25 members who have committed to voting against the American Health Care Act, which is supported by President Donald Trump and Speaker of the House Paul Ryan. 
The Republicans can only afford to lose 22 members and still pass the measure, which is expected to be unanimously opposed by House Democrats. Advertisement - story continues below Related Stories FBI Investigating Conservative Sites For Possible Russian Links 
The vote is scheduled for Thursday. 
Trump met with about a dozen Freedom Caucus members Wednesday to try to move them to a “yes” vote on the measure, Politico reported . 
Ryan sounded confident he will get the votes needed to push the measure over the top. Advertisement - story continues below 
“We’ve been adding Freedom Caucus votes to this bill all week,” he said Wednesday on Fox Business Network. . @SpeakerRyan : Members promised that we would repeal and replace this disastrous and collapsing law, and that is what we are intent on doing pic.twitter.com/PBWH3wWykL 
— FOX Business (@FoxBusiness) March 22, 2017 
Meadows said in a tweet Wednesday that he is still hopeful he can support the bill, but it needs more changes. I'm still hopeful we can change the bill–I'll continue working around the clock to do so. But I cannot support the #AHCA as it stands. https://t.co/ntbFgggiPu 
— Mark Meadows (@RepMarkMeadows) March 22, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below Clinton Supporter And Media Matters Founder Suffers Heart Attack 
Freedom Caucus members argue the American Health Care Act does not fully repeal Obamacare, as a bill the Republican House and Senate voted for in 2015 did. 
Further, they argue the bill does not institute free-market reforms, including being able to buy health insurance across state lines. 
The conservative advocacy groups Heritage Action, Club For Growth, and Americans for Prosperity remain opposed to the AHCA and have all announced they are key voting the measure for their respective voter scorecards. Big news from @MikeNeedham about our upcoming key vote: pic.twitter.com/7lWAJKevZ0 
— Heritage Action (@Heritage_Action) March 21, 2017 KEY VOTE ALERT – NO on Ryancare. House unnecessarily using Senate rules to limit scope of bill. https://t.co/nPhAOXl9uI 
— CFG + CFG Action (@club4growth) March 22, 2017 In its current form, Americans For Prosperity would key vote AGAINST the #AHCA . https://t.co/cRcBPwNUmF 
White House spokesman Sean Spicer offered a hopeful assessment of gaining the support needed to pass the bill. 
“[T]he count keeps getting stronger for us,” Spicer said during a press briefing Wednesday. 
“Member by member, we keep seeing tremendous support flow in our direction,” he added. “I’m optimistic in the sense of what we’re seeing … and the amount of votes that are flowing our way and not the other way.” What do you think?
